attributes.action: Regulate drones under 250g to protect privacy and prevent misuse
attributes.additional_details: Lightweight drones are being misused to spy on people, invade private spaces, and fly over homes without consent. Current laws don’t cover these smaller drones properly, putting the public’s privacy and safety at risk. The law must close this loophole.
attributes.background: Introduce legislation requiring all drones under 250g with cameras to be registered and subject to the same privacy, safety, and misuse laws as larger drones. This includes flight restrictions, penalties for harassment, and protection for private property.

rejection.details:
Drones with a camera that weigh less than 250g are already subject to regulations that require the user to register for an Operator ID. You can find more information about registration requirements here: https://www.caa.co.uk/drones/getting-started-with-drones-and-model-aircraft/registering-to-fly-drones-and-model-aircraft/

If you'd like something else, you could start a new petition clearly explaining what it is.
